file_content.text: I'm sending you the coordinates of a starship in the Corellian system--the Tenebrous.
I'll meet you there, and we'll destroy the Star Cabal for good.
Holocams missed your exit, and SIS chatter is reporting an Imperial Intelligence operative caught in the explosion.
Officially speaking, you're now dead. Congratulations.
You said we were going to meet.
What's our next step?
Do I get a state funeral?
Never thought I'd hear that.
Spies rarely do.
You're off the conspirators' scanners, if not for long. I'm sending you the coordinates of the starship Tenebrous.
If the conspirators think differently, it was all for naught.
Let's hope the enemy buys it.
They'll believe it long enough. I'll deliver a charred body if I have to.
Showing multiple SIS commando teams approaching your location--trouble, but perfect to witness your "death."
I'm triggering the explosives. Get to that escape tunnel.
--cannot confirm authentication. Do not reply; instead proceed to secure line.
Coordinates attached. Repeat, proceed to--
Scanning the mercenary docking codes. Authenticity confirmed--you can land a speeder on the conspirators' airship.
Remember, your job is to get yourself captured. When you break under interrogation, tell them....
I'll tell them secret reinforcements are coming to Corellia. That the Empire and Republic aren't evenly matched after all.
I remember the mission.
You're very good at your job, you know.
Are you still there?
Hello?
Apologies. It's been a long day.
You need to tell the conspirators that Imperial reinforcements are coming to Corellia. That the Empire and Republic aren't evenly matched after all.
You want me to make them think Imperial reinforcements are coming to Corellia. I will, and I'll do it my way.
Don't get pushy.
Please. We need to make them slip. Even once is enough.
If I don't hear from you in twenty-four hours, I'll try to arrange a rescue. But I don't know what you'll find, and I can't make a promise.
Ready? Conspirator ship, here we come.
We'll be at your back. We will come out of this.
Ready when you are, sir. The conspirator ship awaits.
I am very curious to see this conspirator airship. Let's be going.
You intend to undergo torture. Avoid drinking fluids for one hour prior to avoid accidental death.
I've tracked conspirator resources to an airship above the city--a possible drop point or communications hub. It's defended by a team of mercenaries.
Take out the mercenaries while they're resupplying on the ground, and the ship's docking codes are yours.
Once I'm aboard the airship, how do I proceed?
Understood.
What should I expect from the enemy?
Give me a tactical assessment.
The mercenaries are corporate assassins, formerly of Eidolon Security. But the real danger is aboard the ship.
Once aboard, do I sabotage the engines or just blow the ship to atoms?
Say goodbye to that airship.
Neither, I'm afraid.
I want you to allow yourself to be captured--and interrogated.
They'll ask what you've discovered, and how we're responding. You will break under torture and confess that the Empire has secret reinforcements en route to Corellia.
You're asking me to turn myself over to murderers and brainwashers.
You want me to do what?
I know what I'm asking! But I can't think of anything else.
They've worked out everything to the last man. A discovery like that....
That should cause trouble.
...would force them to scramble. And in the process, they'll expose themselves.
Was it the coma that melted your brain, or is it just desperation?
You've completely lost it.
Don't you dare--you don't know what I've been through.
Convince them their perfect plan has a flaw, and they'll scramble to adjust. In the process, they'll expose themselves.
I can follow their trail to the inner circle; not just identify their methods or resources, but locate our final target. Their center of operations.
I get on board, feed them false information--and hope to get out alive.
Then we have a plan.
Yes. We won't have another chance--if we fail, losing Intelligence will have been just the start.
I've never heard you like this before. Are you alright?
You sound a little rattled.
No. But I can do the work.
I'm alright. I apologize--the situation is difficult.
Your plan will never work.
It's insane!
Please--Imperial Intelligence is gone. You're the only resource we have.
I can't guarantee you a way off that airship--but if we can't trick the Star Cabal, the Empire and the Republic both face decimation.
I'll find a way aboard, and I'll do what I can.
Very well.
Who wants to live forever? I'm in.
At least it'll be interesting.
Thank you.
I'll get onto that ship, and I'll try to pass on the information. But I'll only play your game so far.
I'll figure out something.
I do understand.
I'm sending you locations to check for the mercenaries. Get the docking codes, and I'll contact you again before you leave for the airship.
Situation resolved. The attackers are dead and so is Lord Razer.
It's happening everywhere--Sith and Jedi countering one another, playing into the conspirators' hands.
The Star Cabal saw Corellia coming, and they're using the war to decimate two military forces at once. I can't believe I didn't see it....
Do you have a plan to stop them?
What's our next move?
You saw it--you just couldn't be sure without proof.
It's not your fault.
It took Hunter and the Shadow Arsenal to even give me a clue. But I have a plan.
I'm not pleased with your performance either, but let's keep focused.
Whining won't save us.
We know their methods here, and we have data from Voss and Belsavis. I think I can find Hunter, find all of them.
I have Moff Zamar's report. Transmitting now.
We're lucky to have you, Cipher. Beginning analysis.
To date, our reports have shown the Empire at an advantage on Corellia. Our troops are more numerous, our weapons more advanced.
Zamar's report suggests this advantage was a lie.
The Republic could defeat us after all.
Then our forces are in danger.
Worse than that.
Not to sound paranoid, but he could be compromised, too.
You're sure you can trust him?
Possible, but unlikely. His new data shows this:
Hardly a shocking find, given what we know about the conspirators.
No surprise there.
Granted. But the details are disturbing.
Darths Thanaton, Baras, Vowrawn... half the Sith on the planet are expending Imperial troops on power plays instead of the war.
Add to that the Republic's reinforcements and we're an even match. Both sides could be obliterated--hold on.
This is Lord Razer to all forces! The resistance and its Jedi friends have struck back!
Report to my forward base. They are here--the calves have come to the butcher!
You'd better lend a hand. The Empire can't afford a loss right now.
I'm on my way. Keep working on the data--find out what the conspirators are planning.
Agreed.
Understood. Contact me when you can, and we'll plan the next step.
Do I have to remind you that you're not my Keeper anymore?
Ordering me around again?
I have enough reminders. Thank you.
In the old days, you could've made that a command. Stern, brilliant Keeper....
[Flirt] Ordering me around?
I like to think I'm still stern and brilliant.
We should let him squirm a bit.
Razer should learn humility.
That isn't what we do.
I'm going to continue my analysis. Contact me once you're through.
Intercepting a message from Moff Zamar's transport.
--flight path is too dangerous. We'll set down until the Republic cannons stop firing.
Only a matter of time before they send ground troops. Reinforcements requested--
That's your signal. Get to Zamar before the Republic can, and get his report on our forces.
I found the linkup to Republic headquarters. Connecting now.
Forty-two seconds until intercept. Slicing files... here.
This is Supreme Commander Rans to Corellia Command. I hope General Garza has arrived safely.
She spearheads one of two waves of reinforcements: Hers is a Special Forces-led deployment of armor and infantry.
The second wave is a coalition of foreign powers providing a detachment of battle droids, commandos and shock troops.
Details are attached to this message. Whatever the challenges, we will not give up Corellia.
The Empire isn't prepared for this level of opposition.
What do you know about our forces and strategy?
Explain yourself.
More than enough to know the invisible enemy is manipulating us.
You implied this had something to do with the conspirators.
But what about the Star Cabal?
They can throw all the battalions at us they want. We're in the heart of the Republic, and we aren't turning back.
We've won tougher fights.
The invisible enemy is manipulating us. So long as that continues, we can't win.
Complete your mission to destroy Aegis Base. I've arranged a secure line at Lord Razer's headquarters; after you report in, we need to talk.
I look forward to getting some answers.
Agreed.
It'll be good to work together again.
Can we pull any more data from the Republic computers?
What about this linkup?
Negative. They just severed the link.
I won't be your pawn. Give me answers, or we're finished.
I need to know who you are.
The secure line. I'll tell you everything, Cipher. We'll be partners again.
The secure line. I'll tell you everything, Cipher. We'll work as equals again.
